title: Comical History of Don Quixote, Part 2
description:
Don Quixote encounters courtly life. This is the second of a three-play sequence which was the first dramatization of Cervantes's novel Don Quixote. Written in English by the Playwright and Lyricist Thomas D'Urfey, it was originally performed with music by Henry Purcell (only the lyrics, by D'Urfey, are presented in this recording). - Summary by ToddHW

Cast list:
Duke Ricardo, a Grandee of Spain: Greg Giordano
Cardenio, a witty young Gentleman, his Companion and Friend: Beeswaxcandle
Ambrosio, a young Student of Salumanca, and Kinsman to the Duke, an inveterate Enemy to Women ever since his dear Friend Chrysostom died for Love of Marcella: redrun
Don Quixote, a Frantick Gentleman of the Mancha, who ran mad with reading Books of Chivalry, and supposes himself a Knight-Errant: ToddHW
Manuel, Steward to the Duke, a pleasant witty Fellow, who with Pedro and the Page, manages all the Designs used in the following Don Quixote: Papa Phish
Pedro Rezio, a Doctor of Physick, and Assistant to Manuel in fooling Don Quixote: HelloCentral
Bernardo, Chaplain to the Duke - a positive, testy, morose Fellow: Larry Wilson
Diego, a rough ill-natur'd vicious Fellow, Master of the Duke's Game, and chief Shepherd, in love with Marcella: Alan Mapstone
Page to the Duke, another witty young Fellow, and Agent in the fooling of Don Quixote: Inkell
Sancho Panca, Squire to Don Quixote, a dull, heavy, Country Booby in appearance, but in discourse dry, subtle, and sharp; a great Speaker of Proverbs, which he blunders out upon all occasions, tho never so absurd, or far from the purpose: Adrian Stephens
Dutchess, a merry facetious Lady, that perptually diverts her self with the extravagant Follies of Don Quixote and Sancho: ShrimpPhish
Lucinda, Wife to Cardenio, her Companion: Jenn Broda
Dulcinea del Tobosa, Page to the Duke, commanded by him to personate Don Quixote's feigned Mistress: Inkell
Marcella, a young beautiful Shepherdess of Cordoua, extremely coy, and averse to men at first, but afterwards passionately in Love with Ambrosio: Availle
Donna Rodriguez, Woman to the Dutchess, antiquated, opinionated, and impertinent: Nina Lily
Teresa Pancha, Wife to Sancho - a poor clownish Country-woman: Sonia
Mary, her Daughter, a ramping ill-bred Dowdy: Lynette Caulkins
Flora, 1st Country-woman: N. Kray
Risotta, 2nd Country-woman: Brian Fullen
Messenger: Epachuko
Clown: Alan Mapstone
His Wife: Agnes Robert Behr
Cryer: Brize C
Taylor: Jon Hunter
Gardiner: Brian Fullen
Constable: heljar
Canter: Jessie Percival
Woman: Michele Eaton
Small Man: Michael Reilly
Stage Directions: Winnifred Assmann
Editing: ToddHW
